meanings.definition: To cry weakly or querulously; whine
meanings.sent1: The kitten would mewl softly when it wanted attention.
meanings.sent2: The baby started to mewl when it was hungry.
meanings.sent3: The puppy would mewl in protest when bath time came around.
meanings.sent4: The wind made the branches mewl like a sad ghost in the night.
meanings.sent5: Her mewling plea for help echoed through the empty hallway.

meanings.sent1: The mewl of the kitten was barely audible in the room.
meanings.sent2: The mewl of the puppy tugged at my heartstrings.
meanings.sent3: The mewl of the baby was met with a chorus of 'awws' from the family.
meanings.sent4: The mewl of the wind outside added to the eerie atmosphere of the old house.
meanings.sent5: The mewl of the lost child pierced through the silence of the forest.
